follow_up: Nephrology clinic in 2 weeks
warning_signs: Swelling, shortness of breath, decreased urine output
discharge_instructions: Monitor blood pressure daily, weigh yourself daily

follow_up: Nephrology clinic in 3 days for repeat creatinine
warning_signs: Decreased urine output, confusion, severe nausea
discharge_instructions: Avoid nephrotoxic medications, rest adequately

medications: Sevelamer 800mg three times daily with meals
dietary_restrictions: Low potassium, low phosphorus, protein 1.2g/kg/day, fluid restriction (750mL/day)
follow_up: Dialysis MWF, nephrology clinic in 1 month
warning_signs: Chest pain, severe shortness of breath, missed dialysis
discharge_instructions: Protect dialysis access, no blood pressure checks on access arm

follow_up: Nephrology clinic in 2 weeks with urine protein collection
warning_signs: Severe swelling, difficulty breathing, signs of infection
discharge_instructions: Monitor weight daily, compression stockings, elevate legs

dietary_restrictions: Low potassium, low phosphorus, moderate protein (0.8g/kg/day)
follow_up: Nephrology clinic in 3 weeks, vascular access evaluation
warning_signs: Severe fatigue, irregular heartbeat, muscle weakness
discharge_instructions: Prepare for dialysis education, avoid NSAIDs

follow_up: Nephrology clinic in 1 month with liver function tests
warning_signs: Severe flank pain, fever, blood in urine
discharge_instructions: Monitor for cyst infections, genetic counseling referral

dietary_restrictions: Diabetic diet, low sodium, moderate protein restriction
follow_up: Nephrology clinic in 4 weeks, endocrinology in 2 weeks
warning_signs: Blood glucose <70 or >300, swelling, decreased urine output
discharge_instructions: Check blood glucose four times daily, HbA1c target <7%

follow_up: Nephrology clinic in 2 weeks with urine protein
warning_signs: Fever, new rash, severe fatigue, decreased urine output
discharge_instructions: Sun protection, infection precautions, monthly urine checks

follow_up: Nephrology clinic in 4 weeks
warning_signs: Gross hematuria, severe swelling, decreased urine output
discharge_instructions: Avoid NSAIDs, report upper respiratory infections

dietary_restrictions: Adequate hydration, no specific restrictions during recovery
follow_up: Nephrology clinic in 1 week for creatinine check
warning_signs: Decreased urine output, confusion, severe weakness
discharge_instructions: Avoid contrast dyes, NSAIDs, and aminoglycosides

dietary_restrictions: Avoid grapefruit, raw fish, unpasteurized dairy
follow_up: Transplant clinic in 3 days, twice weekly initially
warning_signs: Fever, decreased urine output, pain over graft, weight gain
discharge_instructions: Take immunosuppressants at exact times, monitor temperature daily

dietary_restrictions: Low potassium, low phosphorus, protein 0.6g/kg/day, fluid restriction (1L/day)
follow_up: Nephrology clinic in 1 week for dialysis access surgery
warning_signs: Severe shortness of breath, chest pain, confusion
discharge_instructions: Dialysis education classes, prepare for access placement

follow_up: Nephrology clinic in 4 weeks
warning_signs: Severe headache, vision changes, chest pain
discharge_instructions: Monitor blood pressure twice daily, target <130/80

medications: Intraperitoneal vancomycin and ceftazidime per protocol
dietary_restrictions: Adequate protein (1.2-1.5g/kg/day), limit potassium and phosphorus
follow_up: Nephrology clinic in 3 days, continue PD training
warning_signs: Cloudy dialysate, abdominal pain, fever
discharge_instructions: Strict aseptic technique, inspect dialysate with every exchange

follow_up: Nephrology clinic in 1 week with repeat urinalysis
warning_signs: Gross hematuria, severe swelling, decreased urine output
discharge_instructions: Monitor urine color, avoid strenuous activity

follow_up: Nephrology clinic in 2 weeks with urine protein collection
warning_signs: Severe swelling, difficulty breathing, signs of infection
discharge_instructions: Monitor weight daily, report steroid side effects

follow_up: Nephrology clinic in 3 days for CK and creatinine
warning_signs: Dark urine, muscle pain, decreased urine output
discharge_instructions: Avoid strenuous exercise, no statins until cleared

primary_diagnosis: Chronic Kidney Disease Stage 3 with Anemia
dietary_restrictions: Low sodium, moderate protein, iron-rich foods
follow_up: Nephrology clinic in 4 weeks for hemoglobin check
warning_signs: Severe fatigue, rapid heartbeat, shortness of breath
discharge_instructions: Monitor for signs of anemia, avoid NSAIDs

follow_up: Nephrology clinic in 2 weeks, may need biopsy repeat
warning_signs: Worsening swelling, gross hematuria, severe fatigue
discharge_instructions: Long-term steroid therapy planned, bone health monitoring

follow_up: Nephrology clinic in 2 weeks, consider angioplasty
warning_signs: Flash pulmonary edema, uncontrolled hypertension, decreased urine output
discharge_instructions: Monitor blood pressure three times daily, avoid dehydration

primary_diagnosis: Chronic Kidney Disease Stage 4 with Hyperkalemia
dietary_restrictions: Low potassium (<2g/day), low phosphorus, avoid salt substitutes
follow_up: Nephrology clinic in 3 days for repeat potassium level
warning_signs: Irregular heartbeat, muscle weakness, palpitations
discharge_instructions: Avoid high potassium foods, no bananas or oranges

dietary_restrictions: Low sodium (2g/day), consistent vitamin K intake
follow_up: Nephrology clinic in 1 week for INR check
warning_signs: Signs of bleeding, severe infection, leg swelling
discharge_instructions: Monthly INR checks, infection precautions due to immunosuppression

follow_up: Nephrology clinic in 2 months, audiology and ophthalmology referrals
warning_signs: Gross hematuria, hearing loss worsening, vision changes
discharge_instructions: Genetic counseling, regular hearing and eye exams

follow_up: Nephrology clinic in 5 days for creatinine check
warning_signs: Decreased urine output, severe nausea, confusion
discharge_instructions: Avoid contrast studies for 3 months if possible

primary_diagnosis: Chronic Kidney Disease with Secondary Hyperparathyroidism
dietary_restrictions: Low phosphorus diet, avoid dairy products
follow_up: Nephrology clinic in 4 weeks for PTH and calcium levels
warning_signs: Bone pain, fractures, muscle weakness
discharge_instructions: Take phosphate binders with meals, calcium monitoring

dietary_restrictions: Adequate protein intake, no specific restrictions
follow_up: Nephrology clinic in 1 week, consider plasmapheresis continuation
warning_signs: Hemoptysis, severe shortness of breath, decreased urine output
discharge_instructions: Infection precautions, avoid smoking and secondhand smoke

follow_up: Nephrology clinic in 1 month, cardiology follow-up
warning_signs: Severe pain crises, stroke symptoms, cardiac symptoms
discharge_instructions: Enzyme replacement therapy lifelong, family screening recommended

follow_up: Nephrology clinic in 1 week, vascular surgery in 2 weeks
warning_signs: Recurrent severe hypertension, flank pain, decreased urine output
discharge_instructions: Monitor blood pressure twice daily, avoid NSAIDs

follow_up: Nephrology clinic in 3 days for repeat labs
warning_signs: Confusion, severe headache, decreased urine output, bleeding
discharge_instructions: Watch for signs of infection, carry antibiotic card

primary_diagnosis: Chronic Kidney Disease with Metabolic Acidosis
follow_up: Nephrology clinic in 4 weeks with basic metabolic panel
warning_signs: Rapid breathing, confusion, severe fatigue
discharge_instructions: Take bicarbonate with meals, monitor for GI upset

follow_up: Nephrology clinic in 2 weeks with urinalysis
warning_signs: Worsening swelling, gross hematuria, decreased urine output
discharge_instructions: Expect gradual improvement over 6-8 weeks

primary_diagnosis: Chronic Kidney Disease Stage 2 with Proteinuria
follow_up: Nephrology clinic in 3 months with 24-hour urine collection
warning_signs: New swelling, decreased urine output, frothy urine
discharge_instructions: Monitor blood pressure at home, avoid NSAIDs

follow_up: Nephrology clinic in 2 weeks, hematology/oncology in 1 week
warning_signs: Worsening swelling, cardiac symptoms, severe fatigue
discharge_instructions: Close monitoring with both nephrology and oncology

dietary_restrictions: Increase fluid intake to 2.5-3L/day, low sodium, limit oxalate foods
follow_up: Nephrology clinic in 6 weeks with 24-hour urine collection
warning_signs: Severe flank pain, fever, inability to urinate
discharge_instructions: Strain urine for stones, adequate hydration critical

follow_up: Nephrology clinic in 2 weeks for creatinine monitoring
warning_signs: Livedo reticularis, toe discoloration, decreased urine output
discharge_instructions: Avoid invasive vascular procedures if possible

follow_up: Nephrology clinic in 1 week, hematology/oncology in 3 days
warning_signs: Decreased urine output, confusion, bone pain
discharge_instructions: Close coordination between nephrology and oncology required

follow_up: Nephrology clinic in 4 weeks, hematology follow-up
warning_signs: Pain crisis, decreased urine output, gross hematuria
discharge_instructions: Avoid dehydration, maintain close hematology follow-up

primary_diagnosis: Chronic Kidney Disease Stage 3 with Fluid Overload
follow_up: Nephrology clinic in 1 week
warning_signs: Difficulty breathing, rapid weight gain, severe swelling
discharge_instructions: Weigh daily at same time, call if weight increases >3 lbs in 24 hours

dietary_restrictions: Low sodium, fluid restriction per hepatology
follow_up: Nephrology and hepatology clinic in 3 days
warning_signs: Confusion, severe abdominal swelling, decreased urine output
discharge_instructions: Liver transplant evaluation initiated, close monitoring required
